div.p: The mission of Bottineau Public Schools is to provide students opportunities to develop their potential intellectually, socially and physically as they prepare to meet the challenges of a diverse global society.
Posted by Kody Backman on Apr 21, 2020 in Covid-19, School Board | 0 comments

As per Governor Burgum’s Executive Order 2020-19 issued on April 2, 2020 relating to the COVID-19 Pandemic, he has waived our statutory requirement to designate one or more physical polling locations and will permit school districts to conduct their 2020 annual school board election via absentee ballot. At the Bottineau School Board Meeting the Bottineau Board voted to hold our June 2, 2020 election by absentee ballot only and will not have a polling place for voters to come and cast their vote. How do you vote: 1. The ND Secretary of State...
Posted by Kody Backman on Apr 20, 2020 in Covid-19 | 0 comments

Students’ personal belongs will be distributed via the following procedures: RURAL BUS STUDENTS Students assigned to a rural bus route, will have their materials dropped at their door step on Tuesday, April 21st. This will be a non-contact delivery, please do not come to the bus. (This does not cover students riding in-town bus routes.) *If you have school library books, please place them on your step in a plastic bag for return. NON-BUS STUDENTS Students will be able to pick up their personal materials on Wednesday, April 22nd and Thursday,...
Posted by alysa-palmer on Apr 19, 2020 in High School, Uncategorized | 0 comments

Our March Students of the Month are: MJ Aasen (Grades 10-12) and Christopher Laframboise (Grades 7-9). This month’s pillar was fairness. The following traits were evaluated: Play by the rules • Take turns and share • Be open-minded; listen to others • Don’t take advantage of others • Don’t blame others carelessly • Treat all people fairly. Congrats MJ and...
Posted by alysa-palmer on Apr 16, 2020 in High School | 0 comments

Congratulations to Bottineau FBLA! The following winners were just announced during the ND FBLA Virtual Awards ceremony: *Claire Brown-1st Place Introduction to Business *Taylen Strand-2nd Place Sports & Entertainment Management *Becca Benson & Claire Brown-3rd Place Digital Video Production Nico Loberg-5th Place Sales Presentation Sutton Shurley-8th Place Cyber Security Bottineau FBLA Chapter-Membership Acheivement Award *National Qualifiers Congratulations to all! We are very proud of you!
